mythos.name: A Dark Wind Covers Arkham
text: Inky clouds blow in from the east, bringing with them sickness and fear.
The terror level increases by 1. The maximum Stamina of all investigators in Arkham is reduced by 1.
Horror checks in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty.

mythos.name: A New Dawn!
text: Each investigator who is currently at 2 or less Sanity gains 1 Sanity.
Each investigator who is currently at 2 or less Stamina gains 1 Stamina.

mythos.name: A Sandstorm!?
text: Contrary to all common sense, a sandstorm hits Arkham out of nowhere. Sand clogs the streets and buries entire buildings. Strangely enough, some places that are said to have a dark past seem to be spared.
Investigators must spend 2 additional movement points to enter locations marked with a green diamond.

While this card is in play, any investigator who is in a street area during the city encounter phase and doesn't have to perform any other actions during the phase (e.g. an exhibit encounter) can perform a luck test (-1). If he is successful, he may draw 1 exhibit item.

mythos.name: A Strange Plague
text: Investigators cannot gain Stamina except by receiving medical care in St. Mary's Hospital or from Vincent Lee.

mythos.name: Aldeberan Ascendant
text: Flying creatures do not move to the sky.
Gates to Another Dimension cannot be closed or sealed.

mythos.name: Alien Technology
text: Mig-Go have their toughness increased by 2. If an investigator passes a **Combat check** against a Mi-Go, he draws 1 extra Unique Item.

mythos.name: All Quite in Arkham
text: Each player may pass a **Lick (-1) check** to be *Blessed*

mythos.name: Along Came Jones
text: The first investigator who ends his movement in the Train Station draws 1 Ally, then discards this card from play.

mythos.name: Amnesiac Professor's Memory Returns!
text: Place 2 Clue tokens in each location with an elder sign.

mythos.name: An Evil Fog
text: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty
Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus
Fliers do not move

mythos.name: Angry Red Skies
text: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Lore checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
Fliers do not move to or from the Sky.

mythos.name: Another Time, Another Place!
text: Every open gate leading to Another Dimension or Another Time releases one monster into its location.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Balmy
text: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Fight checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
When moving, stalkers move to investigators in street areas or unstable locations up to 2 spaces away.

mythos.name: Bank Foreclosure
text: An archaeological expedition to Egypt sponsored by the bank has disappeared without a trace ... which means no returns on the bank's investment. Concerned for their savings, townsfolk rush the bank to withdraw their funds.

Any investigators in Arkham with Bank Loans must pay them off immediately. You may sell items at half their list price (round down) if you do not have the $10; if you cannot or will not pay, you are arrested.

mythos.name: Bank Targeted By Grifters
text: Ongoing Effect: Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).

Pass: If an investigator who either is the Deputy of Arkham or has a Sheldon Gang Membership (from the Dunwich Horror expansion) discards 3 Clue tokens while at the Bank of Arkham, return this card to the box. Each investigator then gains $10.
Fail: If there are 6 Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. Each investigator must discard all of his money and any Retainer cards.

mythos.name: Big Storm Sweeps Arkham!
text: All monster in the Sky and Outskirts are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Bizarre Couriers
text: They come bearing strange messages, wrapped in ragged cloaks and hiding their pale flesh. Those who receive packages from them shudder at the memory of them, saying that they have the appearance of *plump, white grave worms*.
Investigators in Arkham may immediately trade items or money without being in the same location. However, each investigator involved in the transaction loses 1 Sanity per item given or received.

mythos.name: Bizarre Dreams Plague Citizens!
text: All Gugs and Nightgaunts in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

mythos.name: Black Sabbath!
text: All Rat-things, Witches, and Warlocks in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Blackest Night
text: Luck checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.

mythos.name: Blood Magic
text: Investigators who end their movement in Rivertown streets may choose to delve into the dark mysteries using their life force. They roll dice equal to their current Stamina, and for every failed die they lose 1 Stamina. If this reduces them to 0 Stamina, they are **devoured** and the player must start a new character. Itherwise, they gain 3 Clue tokens.

mythos.name: Blue Flu!
text: All investigators in jail are released. No investigators may be *arrested* until the end of the next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Blue Plate Special
text: Investigators who end their movement in Velma's Diner may spend up to $4 instead of having an Arkham encounter. They gain 1 Stamina and 1 Sanity for every $1 spent.

mythos.name: Blue Skies
text: All Investigators receive -1 Sneak, +1 Speed.

mythos.name: Book Sale
text: Investigators who end their movement in the Library may spend $2 instead of having an Arkham encounter. Any investigator that does so then takes the first Tome from the Unique Items deck.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Brawling in the Streets
text: Any investigator in a street area at the end of the Mythos phase must make a Fight (+0) check. If he fails and the terror level is 3 or less, he loses 1 Stamina. If he fails the check and the terror level is 4 or higher, he loses 2 Stamina.

mythos.name: Break-In at Neil's
text: The thieves carelessly break a dangerous artifact, releasing 2 monsters into the South Shore streets.

mythos.name: Brutal Accident!
text: The first player must choose one investigator (even himself). That investigator loses 3 Stamina.

mythos.name: Campus Security Increased!
text: All monsters in the Miskatonic U. streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Cash on the Hoof!
text: The first player finds $2 lying on the ground.

mythos.name: Charity Auction!
text: Deal a number of cards from the top of the Common Item deck equal to the number of players. Each player may purchase one item at its listed cost plus $1. Discard any items not purchased.

mythos.name: Charity Case!
text: The investigator with the lowest Sanity (the first player breaks ties) may move to Arkham Asylum and be delayed to restore his Sanity to its maximum.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Checkered Cab Trials Begin!
text: Arkham experiments with mass transit.
All investigators in Arkham may move directly to any street location in Arkham as their entire move (ignore all monsters between their current location and their destination).

mythos.name: Church Boycotts Exhibit
text: Father Michael organizes his congregation against the *Legacy of the Pharaohs* museum exhibit, calling the displays *ghastly and an affront against the Lord*.
Lore checks in Arkham are made at a -2 penalty. Will checks in Arkham are made at a +2 bonus.

mythos.name: Church Group Reclaims Southside!
text: All monsters in the Southside streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Citizens Urged to Lock Doors
text: Monsters appear in the Outskirts until the Outskirts limit is reached. If the Outskirts already contains the maximum number of monsters, return all of the monsters in the Outskirts to the monster cup and increase the terror level by 1.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: City Gripped by Blackouts!
text: The General Store, Curiositie Shoppe, and Ye Olde Magick Shoppe are closed until the end of the next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Closed Mouths
text: While this card is in play, Clue tokens do not appear on the board when mythos cards are resolved.
No clue appears and no monsters move.

mythos.name: Clothing Drive
text: Father Michael sends out a call for clothing. *Have you seen our streets? The homeless have been reduced to wearing rags and dirty strips!* In fact, the beings he has seen on the street are mummies, come to life and escaped from the visiting museum exhibit!

While this card is in play, investigators without Exhibit Items must evade or fight a Mummy in each street location they enter. These Mummies have the same stats as Zombies except with a toughness of 2, and cannot be taken as trophies.

mythos.name: Compass Needles Point South!
text: The first player chooses two investigators. Those investigators immediately exchange locations, ignoring all monsters and movement restrictions.

mythos.name: Construction Crew Conundrum!
text: While digging, a work crew uncovers ancient artifacts ... and ancient monsters.
A monster appears at the Downtown streets and the Miskatonic U. streets.

mythos.name: Contagion Kills Life in Blasted Heath!
text: All monsters in the Blasted Heath streets or locations are returned to the cup.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Cops Sweep Kingsport!
text: All monsters in Kingsport street areas or locations are returned to the monster cup.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Corpse Garden
text: Investigators who end their movement in the Central Hill streets gain 2 Clue tokens, then lose 1 Sanity and 1 Stamina.
All flying monsters move.

mythos.name: Corpses Preserved
text: Monster trophies come to life! Each investigator in Arkham must randomly choose one of his collected monster trophies. That monster surprises him. If the investigator defeats the monster, he may draw cards from the Exhibit Item deck equal to its toughness, take one, and discard the rest. Only monsters that are defeated may be taken as trophies again; if the investigator flees or the monster defeats him, the monster is returned to the box.

mythos.name: Cosmic Upheaval!
text: Investigators that are currently in Other Worlds must immediately pass a Luck (-1) check or be lost in time and space.

mythos.name: Couriers in Town!
text: Until the end of next turn, investigators may trade Items with one another without being in the same space. Leave this card in place to signify this. Items may only be traded in this manner during Upkeep.

mythos.name: Cover-up
text: When this card enters play, place 3 Clue tokens per player on it. Any player may discard monster trophies while in the Downtown streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove 1 Clue token from this card for each toughness worth of monsters discarded.
**Outgoing Effect**: Place 1 Clue token per player on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).
**Pass**: If there are no Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. Each investigator is Blessed, and gains a Retainer.
**Fail**: If there are 6 Clue tokens per player on this card, return it to the box. All investigators lose all of their Clue tokens, and all Clue tokens are removed from the board.

mythos.name: Curfew Enforced
text: Any investigator who ends his movement in the streets must pass a **Will (+0) check** or be arrested and taken to the Police Station.

mythos.name: Cursed Relics
text: Place 5 doom tokens on this card when it comes into play.

Ongoing Effect: At the end of every Mythos Phase after the first, move 1 doom token from this card to the terror track and increase the terror level by 1. Any player may exhaust a ready Exhibit Item or discard a Unique Item to negate both effects.
Pass: If there are no doom tokens on the terror track after the last doom token is removed from this card, discard this card. Each player draws 1 Spell.

Fail: If there are doom tokens on the terror track after the last doom token is removed from this card, discard this card and all doom tokens from the terror track. The terror level rises by a number equal to the number of doom tokens discarded.

mythos.name: Dark Conjunction
text: While this card is in play, all monsters gain Overwhelming 1. Any monster that already has Overwhelming has its Overwhelming rating increased by 1.

mythos.name: Dark Day!
text: Investigators cannot spend Clue tokens to add to skill checks until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then as a reminder.

mythos.name: Dark Shapes at Dusk!
text: All Ghasts, Leng Spiders, and Moon-beasts are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

mythos.name: Dark Skies
text: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
Stalkers move like normal monsters.

mythos.name: Deathly Still
text: Will checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Fight checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
Monsters that move normally are stalkers.

mythos.name: Dire Portents Abound
text: Investigators receive -1 to checks to close Gates.

mythos.name: Darkes Carnival Arrives
text: Investigators who end their movement in the Northside streets gain 1 Clue token from the sinister wonders they witness, but must pass a **Will (-1) check** or lose 1 Sanity.

mythos.name: Disturbin the Dead
text: **Outgoing Effect**: Roll a die at the end of every **Mythos Phase** while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it entered play). On a 1 or 2, increase the terror level by 1.
**Pass**: If a single player discards 2 gate trophies during the **Arkham Encounter Phase** while in the Rivertown streets, return this card to the box. Each player draws 1 Spell.
**Fail**: If the terror level reaches 10, return this card to the box. Every investigator is *Cursed*.

mythos.name: Double the Trouble
text: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

mythos.name: Dreams of a Sunken City
text: Investigators cannot gain Sanity except by recieving psychiatric care in Arkham Asylum or from Carolyn Fern.

mythos.name: Dunwich Villagers Drive Out Undesirables!
text: All monsters in the Village Commons streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Early Frost
text: As they slip and fall on the ice, each investigator loses 1 Stamina for each movement point over 3 he spends each turn. Reading Tomes does not count towards this total.

mythos.name: Eccentric Opens Doors
text: Investigators who end their movement in the French Hill streets may discard 1 Gate trophy to draw 1 Unique Item.

mythos.name: Eerie Coincidences
text: Two Gates open this turn, but no doom tokens are added to the doom track.

mythos.name: Egyptian Exhibit Visits Miskatonic U.
text: Any investigator who ends his movement in the Miskatonic U. streets may pass a **Lore (-1) check** to gain 1 Clue token by reading the strange heiroglyphics on the artifacts in the exhibit.

mythos.name: Endlessly Breeding
text: Ongoing Effect: At the end of each Mythos phase, draw a second Mythos card and ignore everything on it except for its monster movement pattern. Each time an investigator is reduced to 0 Stamina or 0 Sanity, place a Clue token on this card.

Pass: If a single investigator discards $10 while at the Riverside Docks, return this card to the box. Starting with the first player, each player chooses a monster in play and takes it as a monster trophy (ignoring Endless).
Fail: If there are ever 3 Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. A monster surge occurs, then add a doom token to the doom track for each Hex monster in play.

mythos.name: Escape from Arkham Asylum!
text: The inmates at the Asylum all begin chanting in an ancient language, and overpower the orderlies! *Nephren-Ka! Nephren-Ka!* The streets flood with the insane.
Collect up to 3 Maniacs, drawing them first from the monster cup, then from the Outskirts, then from those claimed as trophies. Place them all in the Downtown streets.
Investigators who defeat all 3 Maniacs before the end of next turn may draw 1 Exhibit Item. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Estate Sale
text: Investigators who end their movement in the Uptown streets may draw 2 Unique Items and purchase one, none, or both of them at list price, discarding any that are not purchased.

mythos.name: Evidence Destroyed!
text: A massive conspiracy sets back the investigation. Discard all Clue tokens from the board.
No clue appears and no monsters move.

mythos.name: Family Found Butchered!
text: The terror level increased by 1 in light of this tragic news.

mythos.name: Feds Raid Arkham!
text: All monsters in the streets are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Fire at the Mill!
text: Until the end of the next turn, any time an investigator draws 1 or more Common Items for any reason, he draws 1 fewer cards (to a minimum of 0). Leave this card in play to indicate this.

mythos.name: Fires in the Night
text: Monsters at the Woods do not move.
Monsters in the Uptown streets who move move to the woods.

mythos.name: Footprints on Shore!
text: It seems that 2 monsters have come ashore in the Innsmouth Shore streets.

mythos.name: Forgery!
text: Until the end of next turn, any time an investigator draws 1 or more Unique Items for any reason, he draws 1 fewer cards (to a minimum of 0). Leave this card in play to indicate this.

mythos.name: Formal Dress Gala Announced!
text: Each investigator may choose to immediately spend $5 to gain 2 Sanity and 2 Clue tokens.

mythos.name: Fourth of July Parade!
text: Investigators cannot move into our out of the Merchant Dist. streets until the end of the next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Free Clinic!
text: The investigator with the lowest Stamina (the first player breaks ties) may move to St. Mary's Hospital and be delayed to restore his Stamina to its maximum.

mythos.name: Full Moon
text: All monsters have their Sanity damage increased by 1.

mythos.name: Fund Drive for the Arts
text: The performance of the controversial *The King in Yellow* have increased local enthusiasm for the arts, and the Historical Society is taking advantage of it with a fundraising auction.

Investigators in Arkham may immediately spend up to $1 for every Ally left in the Ally deck. For every $2 an investigator spends, he may draw one card from the Unique Item deck. He then takes one card from among those he has drawn and shuffles the rest back into the deck.

mythos.name: Funnel Clouds
text: Any investigator who ends his movement in the streets must pass a Luck (+1) check or be devoured.
All flying monsters are returned to the monster cup.

mythos.name: Gangs Clean Up Easttown!
text: All the monsters in the Easttown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Gathering Storm!
text: The situation in Innsmouth continues to worsen. Add one uprising token to the Deep Ones Rising track.

mythos.name: Ghost Ship Docks by Itself!
text: An ancient ghost ship arrives in Arkham, releasing 2 monsters into the Merchant Dist. streets.

mythos.name: Goat-like Creature Spotted in Woods!
text: All Dark Young in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

mythos.name: Good Traveling Conditions
text: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Speed checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus, and investigators receive 1 extra movement point.
Monsters that move normally are fast.

mythos.name: Good Work Undone
text: When this card enters play, place 6 Clue tokens on it. Any player may spend Clue tokens during the **Arkham Encounter Phase** while in the Easttown streets to discard Clue tokens from this card on a 1-for-1 basis.
Ongoing Effect: Roll two dice at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play). For every 1 or 2 rolled, place one Clue token on this card.
Pass: If there are no Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. Each player draws one unique item.
Fail: If there are 10 Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. All elder sign tokens are removed from the board.

mythos.name: Gossip Runs Wild!
text: If the Dunwich Horror is in play, increase the terror level by 2.
Investigators can trade Clue tokens like other Items until the end of next turn. Leave this card in play until then to show this.

mythos.name: Graverobbers Strike!
text: Unfortunately for them, they release 2 monsters into the Central Hill streets.

mythos.name: Gypsy Caravan
text: Investigators who end their movement in the Southside Streets may roll a die. On a success, they gain $2. On a failure, they lose $1.

mythos.name: Hallelujah!
text: The first investigator who ends his movement in South Church is Blessed, then discards this card from play.

mythos.name: Happy Days are Here Again
text: Due to the renewed prosperity that has come to Arkham, the terror level cannot increase.

mythos.name: Heat Wave
text: Fight checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty
Lore checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
Fire Vampires have their tougness increased by 1.

mythos.name: Hellene Sighted!
text: The ancient ship briefly docks, releasing 2 monsters into the Harborside streets.

mythos.name: Help Wanted
text: The first investigator without a Retainer who ends his movement at the Newspaper gains a Retainer, then discards this card from play.

mythos.name: High Tides
text: The tides seem to be defying the tidal charts, causing elevated water levels far upriver.
Investigators in Rivertown, Easttown, and Merchant District streets or locations must pass a Fight (-1) Check or be delayed.

mythos.name: Horns of the Black Goat
text: Dark Young have their toughness increased by 1.

mythos.name: Horrifying Sight!
text: The first player must choose one investigator (even himself). That investigator loses 3 Sanity.

mythos.name: Horror at Groundbreaking!
text: An ancient stone is disturbed by the construction, releaseing 2 monsters into the Miskatonic U. streets.

mythos.name: Hospital Patients Disappear!
text: All investigators who have an Injury card (from the Dunwich Horror expansion) or whose Stamina is currently 2 or less move immediately to the first area of Another Dimension.

mythos.name: Icy Conditions
text: Investigators recive 1 less movement point during the Movement Phase.

mythos.name: Ill Wind Grips Arkham!
text: The first player must pass a **Luck (-1) check** or be *Cursed*.

mythos.name: Impassable Streets
text: An investigator may not move to a street area if there is a black movement arrow leading to it from his present street area. This does not effect moving from a location to a street area or from a street area to a location.

mythos.name: Infestation of Rats
text: Each investigator in Ma's Boarding House or Velma's Diner at the end of the Mythos Phase, as well as each investigator in First National Grocery, Gilman House Hotel, or Innsmouth Jail on the Innsmouth Horror expansion game board at the end of the Mythos Phase, loses 1 Sanity.

mythos.name: Innsmouth Invasion!
text: The city of Innsmouth is suddenly crawling with monsters. A monster appears in the Church Green streets, the Innsmouth Shore streets, the Factory District streets, Sawbone Alley, and Devil Reef.

mythos.name: Innsmouth is Restless
text: While this card is in play, investigators who end their movement in Innsmouth receive a -1 penalty to their Evade check to avoid being arrested once martial law is declared in Innsmouth.

mythos.name: Innsmouth Sleeps
text: While this card is in play, investigators who end their movement in Innsmouth do not need to make the usual Evade check to avoid being arrested once martial law is declared in Innsmouth.

mythos.name: Intermission
text: The town of Arkham collectively holds its breath as the terrible play *The King in Yellow* builds to a crescendo, preparing to reveal its darkest horrors. But for the moment, nothing happens. No gates open, but the terror level is increased by 2.

mythos.name: Jail Break!
text: However, it appears that whatever was being held in the jail wasn't quite human, so 2 monsters are released into the Church Green streets.

mythos.name: Jail Break!
text: However, it appears that whatever was being held in the jail wasn't quite human, so 2 monsters are released into the Church Green streets.

mythos.name: King of Cards Cancels Show
text: Erich Weiss, a famous visiting escape artist and master of illusion, was scheduled to put on a show. However, when he was told that the *Legacy of the Pharaohs* museum exhibit was in town, he paled visibly and canceled the performance. *There is a thing I must do* was his only comment.
All Witches and Warlocks in Arkham are returned to the cup. If any investigator has Eric Weiss as an Ally, that investigator gains those monsters as trophies.

mythos.name: Kingsport Mists
text: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
The Causeway, the Wireless Station, and the Strange High House in the Mists are closed while this card remains in play.

mythos.name: Lightning Storm
text: At the start of each Upkeep Phase while this card is in play, roll a die. On a 1 or 2, the first player must choose an investigator in a street area (if there are any). That investigator loses a die of Stamina and moves to St. Mary's Hospital.

mythos.name: Lightning Strikes Twice!
text: Two similar rocks are shattered by lightning strikes in different parts of Arkham, each releasing a monster. A monster appears at the French Hill streets and the Uptown streets.

mythos.name: Local Heiress Missing!
text: If any player has Asenath Waite as an Ally, she is returned to the box and a doom token is added to the Ancient One's doom track.

mythos.name: Lodge Members Watch the Night!
text: All monsters in the French Hill streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Lynch Mob!
text: One Ally is randomly drawn from the Ally deck and returned to the box.

mythos.name: Mad Bomber
text: Mythos Ability: When this card enters play, place $4 per player on it. Any player may pay money while in the Merchant District streets during the Arkham Encounters Phase to remove money from this card on a 1-for-1 basis.
Ongoing Effect: Place $1 per player on this card at the end of every Mythos Phase (beginning the turn after it entered play).
Pass: If there is no money on this card, return it to the box. Each player gains 2 Clue tokens.
Fail: If there is $8 per player on this card, return it to the box. Every Investigator must immediately draw 1 Injury and 1 Madness card.

mythos.name: Manhunt in Arkham!
text: All monsters in location are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Merchants March on Crime!
text: All monsters in the Merchant Dist. streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Miskatonic Arctic Expedition Returns!
text: Any Elder Things previously claimed as monster trophies by players return to life and are placed in the River Docks.

mythos.name: Missing People Return!
text: All investigators currently *lost in time and space* immediately return to Arkham, appearing in a street or location of their choice.

mythos.name: No Once Can Help You Now
text: Gate cannot be **sealed**, although they can still be **closed**.

mythos.name: Noden's Favor
text: It costs 2 fewer Clue tokens to **seal** gates.

mythos.name: Picnickers Panic!
text: A careless picnicker unleashes 2 monsters on the Downtown streets.

mythos.name: Planetary Alignment
text: Thanks to the mystic energy generated by the planetary alignment, all spells have a Sanity cost of 0.

mythos.name: Police Step Up Patrols in Northside!
text: All monsters in the Northside streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Private Security Hired in Updtown!
text: All monsters in the Uptown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Raining Cats and Dogs
text: Speed check in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty, and player receive 1 less movement point during the **Movement Phase**.
Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus
Return any Fire Vamipires in play to the cup. If a fire Vamipire enters play, return it to the cup and draw a different monster.

mythos.name: Rivertown Residents Take Back Streets!
text: All monsters in Rivertown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: R'yleh Rising
text: Star Spanw and Maniacs have their toughness increased by 1.
The difficulty to **seal** or **close** gates to R'yleh is increased by 1.

mythos.name: Scientist Warns of Dimension Rift!
text: All Dimensional Shamblers and Hounds of Tindalos in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

mythos.name: Sheldon Gang Turns to Police for Aid!
text: The Sheldon Gang disturbs a burial mound, releasing 2 monsters in to the Updtown streets.

mythos.name: Slum Murders Continue!
text: An old basement is opened. releasing 2 monsters into the Easttown streets.

mythos.name: Solar Eclipse
text: Due to the interference of the solar eclipse, no spells may be cast.

mythos.name: Southside Strangler Suspected
text: However, the press is mistaken, and the murders were caused by 2 monsters that are released into the Southside streets.

mythos.name: Strange Lights on Campus!
text: The Library, Administration Building, and Science Building are all closed until the end of the next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Strange Power Flux Plagues City!
text: All investigators in Other World aras may immediately return to Arkham.

mythos.name: Strange Tremors Cease!
text: All the Chthonians and Dholes in Arkham are returned to the cup. If at least one monster returns to the cup, raise the terror level by 1.

mythos.name: Sunny and Clear
text: Sneak checks in Arkham are made at a -1 penalty.
Will checks in Arkham are made at a +1 bonus.
If the Haunter in Darkness is in play, return it to the cup. If the Haunter in Darkness enters play, return it to the cup and draw a difference monster.

mythos.name: Temperence Fever Sweeps City
text: Any investigator with Whiskey must pass a **Sneak (-1) check** or get arrested and take to the Police Station. If this occurs the must discard their Whiskey. In addition, Hibbs Roadhouse is closed until the end of the next turn. Leave this card in play until then to indicate this.

mythos.name: Terror at the Train Station!
text: A rusty train arrives in Arkham, disgorgin 2 monsters in the Northside streets

mythos.name: The Chill of the Grave
text: All **Undead** monsters have their toughness increased by 1.

mythos.name: The Festival
text: The festival has begun! Cultists and Byahkee have their toughness increased by 1.

mythos.name: The Great Ritual
text: **Ongoing Effect**: Cultists, Witches, Warlocks, and High Priests have their toughness increased by 2 while this card is in play.
Place 1 Clue token on this card at the end of every **Mythos Phase** (beginning the turn after it entered play).

**Pass**: If a single player discards 3 spells (4 if there are 5 or more players) while in the French HIll streets during the **Arkham Encounters Phase**, return this card to the box. Each player gains 2 Clue tokens.

**Fail**: If there are ever 5 or more Clue tokens on this card, return it to the box. From now on, draw 2 mythos cards each **Mythos Phase**. Ignore everything on the first card except for gate opening.

mythos.name: The Man in Black
text: Investigators who end their movment in the French Hill streets may deal with the Man in Black to gain power. They roll dice equal to their current Sanity, and for every failed die, the lose 1 Sanity. If this reduces them to 0 Sanity, they are **devoured** and the player must start a new character. Otherwise, they gain 1 Clue token and draw 1 Spell

mythos.name: The Southside Strangler Strikes
text: **Ongoing Effect**: Return one Ally from the Ally deck to the box box at random at the end of every **Mythos Phase** while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it entered play). The Southside Strangler has struck again!
**Pass**: If a single player discards 5 Clue tokens while in Ma's Boarding House during the **Arkham Encounter Phase**, return this card to the box. Each player gains $5 as a reward from the police.

**Fail**: If there are no Allies to return to the box at the end of the **Mythos Phase**, return this card to the box. Each player must lower either their maximum Sanity or Stamina (their choice) by 1 for the rest of the game.

mythos.name: The Stars Are Right
text: **Ongoing Effect**: Roll a die at the end of every **Mythos Phase** while this card is in play (beginning the turn after it entered play). On a 1 or 2, place one doom token on the ancient one's doom tack.
**Pass**: If a player discards an Ally card while in the Downtown streets during the **Arkham Encounters Phase**, return this card to the box. Each player draws 2 Common Items.
**Fail**: If the Ancient One awakens, return this card to the box.

mythos.name: The Terrible Experiment
text: When this card enter play, place 5 monsters form the cup on it. Any player may choose to fight one or more of these monsters while in the Miskatonic U. streets during the **Arkham Encounter Phase**. If defeated, they are claimed as trophies. These monsters do not move, are not considered to be on the board, and do not count against the monster limit.
**Ongoing Effect**: Place a monster on this card at the end of every **Mythos Phase** (beginning the turn after it entered play.
**Pass**: If there are no monsters on this card, return it to the box. Each player draws 1 skill.
**Fail**: If there are 8 monsters on this card return it to the box. Raise the terror level to 10 and place the monsters that were on it into play in the Miskatonic U. streeets.

mythos.name: Things of Darkness
text: Ghouls, Formless Spawns, Shaggoths, and Flying Polyps have their toughtness increased by 1.

mythos.name: Vigilante Guard the Night!
text: All monsters in the Downtown streets or locations are returned to the cup.

mythos.name: Witch Burning Anniversary!
text: An ancient curse strikes Arkham, releasing 2 monsters in to the Rivertown streets

mythos.name: Songs from the Woods
text: Goat Span, Tcho-tchos, and Dark Young have their toughness increased by 1.
